revised_title: Thermal Emissivity of Green Leaves in Still and Moving Air
tldr: This article investigates the thermal emissivity of a green leaf in still and moving air, which is crucial for understanding the temperature regulation in plants. The authors developed an experimental method to determine the thermal emissivity of a leaf-lamina and found that the loss of heat from radiation and air convection varies with the size and shape of the cooling body. The study also highlights the importance of air currents in affecting heat transfer from and to the leaf.
